alert.note: Alert for Interior Waldo; Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 07 at 12:52PM EDT until October 08 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .A low pressure system with deep moisture will bring a period of moderate to locally heavy rain to the region this afternoon into tonight. Some localized flooding of urban, low lying, and poor drainage areas will be possible where the heaviest rainfall occurs. Isolated flash flooding is also possible should heavy rainfall rates occur. Fall leaf debris could exacerbate flooding issues if blocking storm drains. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and west central Maine, including the following areas, in south central Maine, Coastal Waldo, Interior Waldo, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln and Southern Somerset. In west central Maine, Central Somerset. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris from Fall foliage.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
